prop.name: videoFormat
prop.desc: The type of screening or video broadcast used (e.g. IMAX, 3D, SD, HD, etc.).

prop.name: subtitleLanguage
prop.desc: Languages in which subtitles/captions are available, in IETF BCP 47 standard format.

prop.name: workPresented
prop.desc: The movie presented during this event.

Event.name: about
Event.desc: The subject matter of the content.

Event.name: funder
Event.desc: A person or organization that supports (sponsors) something through some kind of financial contribution.

Event.name: workFeatured
Event.desc:
A work featured in some event, e.g. exhibited in an ExhibitionEvent.
       Specific subproperties are available for workPerformed (e.g. a play), or a workPresented (a Movie at a ScreeningEvent).

Event.name: audience
Event.desc: An intended audience, i.e. a group for whom something was created.

Event.name: remainingAttendeeCapacity
Event.desc: The number of attendee places for an event that remain unallocated.

Event.name: actor
Event.desc: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc., or in an event. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

Event.name: performers
Event.desc: The main performer or performers of the event—for example, a presenter, musician, or actor.

Event.name: endDate
Event.desc: The end date and time of the item (in ISO 8601 date format).

Event.name: doorTime
Event.desc: The time admission will commence.

Event.name: contributor
Event.desc: A secondary contributor to the CreativeWork or Event.

Event.name: maximumAttendeeCapacity
Event.desc: The total number of individuals that may attend an event or venue.

Event.name: typicalAgeRange
Event.desc: The typical expected age range, e.g. '7-9', '11-'.

Event.name: organizer
Event.desc: An organizer of an Event.

Event.name: attendees
Event.desc: A person attending the event.

Event.name: aggregateRating
Event.desc: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

Event.name: subEvent
Event.desc: An Event that is part of this event. For example, a conference event includes many presentations, each of which is a subEvent of the conference.

Event.name: subEvents
Event.desc: Events that are a part of this event. For example, a conference event includes many presentations, each subEvents of the conference.

Event.name: offers
Event.desc: An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, perform a service, or give away tickets to an event.

Event.name: inLanguage
Event.desc: The language of the content or performance or used in an action. Please use one of the language codes from the IETF BCP 47 standard. See also availableLanguage.

Event.name: attendee
Event.desc: A person or organization attending the event.

Event.name: workPerformed
Event.desc: A work performed in some event, for example a play performed in a TheaterEvent.

Event.name: eventStatus
Event.desc: An eventStatus of an event represents its status; particularly useful when an event is cancelled or rescheduled.

Event.name: startDate
Event.desc: The start date and time of the item (in ISO 8601 date format).

Event.name: director
Event.desc: A director of e.g. tv, radio, movie, video gaming etc. content, or of an event. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

Event.name: superEvent
Event.desc: An event that this event is a part of. For example, a collection of individual music performances might each have a music festival as their superEvent.

Event.name: duration
Event.desc: The duration of the item (movie, audio recording, event, etc.) in ISO 8601 date format.

Event.name: translator
Event.desc: Organization or person who adapts a creative work to different languages, regional differences and technical requirements of a target market, or that translates during some event.

Event.name: previousStartDate
Event.desc: Used in conjunction with eventStatus for rescheduled or cancelled events. This property contains the previously scheduled start date. For rescheduled events, the startDate property should be used for the newly scheduled start date. In the (rare) case of an event that has been postponed and rescheduled multiple times, this field may be repeated.

Event.name: review
Event.desc: A review of the item.

Event.name: sponsor
Event.desc: A person or organization that supports a thing through a pledge, promise, or financial contribution. e.g. a sponsor of a Medical Study or a corporate sponsor of an event.

Event.name: location
Event.desc: The location of for example where the event is happening, an organization is located, or where an action takes place.

Event.name: recordedIn
Event.desc: The CreativeWork that captured all or part of this Event.

Event.name: composer
Event.desc: The person or organization who wrote a composition, or who is the composer of a work performed at some event.

Event.name: isAccessibleForFree
Event.desc: A flag to signal that the item, event, or place is accessible for free.

Event.name: performer
Event.desc: A performer at the event—for example, a presenter, musician, musical group or actor.
